intro: Alyssum montanum proles brigantiacum, commonly known as the Brigantine alpine alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, blooming in spring and early summer. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
